botanical_details.genus: Rosa can be deciduous or semi-evergreen shrubs or scrambling climbers, with usually thorny stems bearing compound pinnate leaves and solitary or clustered flowers. Flowers may be followed by showy red or purple fruits in some varieties.

how_to_grow.cultivation: A very tolerant species which will grow in virtually any garden situation except heavy shade
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by semi-ripe cuttings in late summer or hardwood cuttings in autumn
how_to_grow.pruning: Pruning group 20 (roses). Do not prune after flowering if hips are required
how_to_grow.pests: Aphids, including rose aphid, are the most common rose pest. Can also be affected by leafhoppers, glasshouse red spider mite, scale insects, caterpillars, large rose sawfly, rose leaf-rolling sawfly and leaf-cutter bees. Deer and rabbits may also cause damage
how_to_grow.diseases: Rose black spot, rose rust and rose powdery mildew are the most common rose diseases. May also be affected by rose dieback, replant disease, a canker, honey fungus and a virus
